thread.title: Stars align for new Collingswood business
thread.title_full: Stars align for new Collingswood business

title: Stars align for new Collingswood business
text:
Stars align for new Collingswood business It won't be long now. Post to Facebook Stars align for new Collingswood business It won't be long now. Check out this story on courierpostonline.com: http://on.cpsj.com/1LT57ee Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Tammy Paolino , @CP_TammyPaolino 7:35 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 
The owners of Constellation Collective are (from left) Lindsey Ferguson, Valentina Fortuna and Maura Rosato. (Photo: Photo provided) 
Constellation Collective could open its doors by the end of the month. Tables inside the space were handcrafted by Tom Marchetty of The Factory. (Photo: Constellation Collective) 
It won't be long now. 
Anyone who enjoys eating breakfast sandwiches, hand pies, scones and the like from the culinary artists of Constellation Collective has been patiently awaiting the opening of their first retail space on Haddon Avenue. (Did I mention kielbasa soaked with Exit 15 Flying Fish beer?) 
Constellation Collective is taking over the space formerly occupied by My Little Kupkake in Collingswood at 685 Haddon Ave. (That bakery owner has said she may reopen in a new location. See http://www.mylittlekupkake.com/ for updates). 
Up until now, the three owners of Constellation - Lindsey Ferguson, Valentina Fortuna and Maura Rosato - have plied their wares, everything from chicken and biscuits to goat cheese and cherry hand pies to big fresh salads at the Westmont Farmers Market, Collingswood Farmers Market, Farm & Fisherman Market + Cafe. Their baked goods are still available at Revolution Coffee Roasters down the street, although a new food purveyor will move into their former space. 
By the end of the month, you can look for them to throw open the doors on a bright blue retail space from which they will run a retail and catering business. 
Stay tuned here for much more on that. 
Or visit them Wednesday evening at the final Westmont market of the season.
